author: nmbradford
body:
If a response to invoke-webrequest does not set the content type in the
response header, an object not set exception is thrown in
WebResponseHelper.CoreClr.cs.  Updated to set contenttype = null.

comments.author: msftclas
comments.body: Hi **@nmbradford**, I'm your friendly neighborhood Microsoft Pull Request Bot (You can call me MSBOT). Thanks for your contribution! In order for us to evaluate and accept your PR, we ask that you sign a contribution license agreement. It's all electronic and will take just minutes. I promise there's no faxing. https://cla.microsoft.com. TTYL, MSBOT;

comments.author: nmbradford
comments.body:
I've added a single test for the exception that is thrown by iwr if Content-Type is missing from the response header and addressed the issues in review.  

Also - I have signed the CLA,. but the cla-required label is still attached to this issue?

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
@nmbradford Thanks! LGTM (Only correct the test). 
Wait for maintainers to review and remove cla.

comments.author: nmbradford
comments.body: Thanks for the feedback @vors.  I've updated the PR to prevent the nullref instead of catching.  I also realised the same issue occurs in Invoke-RestMethod and the fix is almost identical, so I added a test for it and address it as well.  Let me know if this needs to go in a separate PR.

comments.author: vors
comments.body: I updated the PR to remove extra blank lines

title: Fix WebRequest failure to handle missing ContentType in response header
